repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Pegi Deitz Shea was born 22 September 1960, in Matawan, NJ, the daughter of George A. Deitz (a high school teacher and coach) and Margaret J. (a legal secretary) Devlin. She attended Rutgers College, Rutgers University (1982) and has been awarded the Evelyn Hamilton Award for Creative Writing, Rutgers College (1982).

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Pegi Deitz Shea was born 22 September 1960, in Matawan, NJ, the daughter of George A. Deitz and Margaret J. Devlin. She attended Rutgers College, Rutgers University (1982) and has been awarded the Evelyn Hamilton Award for Creative Writing, Rutgers College (1982). Ms. Shea is a member of St. Bernard's Christian Service Committee, Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators ( New England SCBWI Conference Planning Committee member, 1992-1993). Ms. Shea is the president of Pegi Deitz Shea Public Relations in addition to being a freelance writer, poet and children's book author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes materials associated with the author's books. Materials for Bungalow, Fungalow (CLC C1190) and The Whispering Cloth, originally titled “Stitches”, includes correspondence, research materials, photographs, manuscripts and galleys of the books, in addition to clippings, presentation and marketing materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of children's literature. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Pegi Deitz Shea Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Ms. Shea in 1999. Ms. Shea has donated materials for later books yearly from 2000-2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, postcards, notes, administrative records, financial records, fliers, books, publications, clippings, photographs, manuscript material [Subjects include: Society of Children’s Book Writers and Illustrators, Dwyers and O’Grady, Agency correspondence & some rejects, Jennifer Flannery, Kouts correspondence, "Liberty Rising," Children’s Writer Guide to 2008, Dr. Launch 1986-1987.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Books, correspondence, illustrations, manuscripts, notes, photographs, publications [Subjects include: American poetry, children's literature, Connecticut authors, young adult literature.]
